intro: [WRONG START] Embilia phaeadenia, commonly known as the golden embelia, is a small evergreen shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its smooth, dark green leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces small, red, fleshy fruits that are edible and often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial shade. Its ornamental value and medicinal properties make it a notable species in horticulture and herbal practices.
